title: The Canary Islands were named after what animal? - Quora

response.answer_text: Sigh. The Canary Islands are in the Atlantic Ocean not the Pacific Ocean. The name “Canary Islands’ comes from the Roman name “Insula Canaria” —literally ‘Island of the Dogs’ in Latin —given by the Mauretanian King Juba II. The birds are named after the islands. The islands had been explored by both Phoencians and Greeks before the Romans and had been called "the Fortunate Isles". However, both groups found either inhabitants or abandoned buildings- so someone got there before them. Canary Islands - Wikipedia

They are named after dogs. From Wikipedia: “The name Islas Canarias is likely derived from the Latin name Canariae Insulae, meaning "Islands of the Dogs", a name that was applied only to Gran Canaria. According to the historian Pliny the Elder, the Mauretanian king Juba II named the island Canaria because it contained "vast multitudes of dogs of very large size".
